block.p: Sara Mills Gregg, a college professor, and Benjamin Shelton Hayes, a lawyer, were married yesterday in Stowe, Vt. The Rev. Robert Tucker Gregg, a minister of the United Church of Christ and a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony at the Stowe Community Church.

Dr. Gregg, 30, is keeping her name. She is an assistant professor of history at Iowa State University in Ames, and is also an environmental historian. She graduated magna cum laude from Middlebury College and received her doctoral degree in history from Columbia.

Sara Mills Gregg, a college professor, and Benjamin Shelton Hayes, a lawyer, were married yesterday in Stowe, Vt. The Rev. Robert Tucker Gregg, a minister of the United Church of Christ and a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony at the Stowe Community Church.

Dr. Gregg, 30, is keeping her name. She is an assistant professor of history at Iowa State University in Ames, and is also an environmental historian. She graduated magna cum laude from Middlebury College and received her doctoral degree in history from Columbia.

She is the daughter of Susan Bernier Gregg and Bentley C. Gregg of Vienna, Va. The bride's father is an environmental scientist in Crystal City, Va., with the Office of Pesticides Programs, part of the Environmental Protection Agency. Her mother is a senior partner in Goodman & Company, an accounting firm.

Mr. Hayes, 36, works in the Reston, Va., offices of Accenture, the consulting company, where he helps his company and its consultants comply with privacy laws and regulations. He graduated from the University of Vermont and received his law degree from Ohio State University.

He is the son of Ann Preston Drennan of Craftsbury, Vt., and the stepson of the late Henry T. Drennan. His mother is an immigration inspector in North Troy, Vt., for the Department of Homeland Security. His stepfather retired as a grants administrator in Washington for the Department of Education.
